info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 2:07PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Power and east central Cassia Counties through 245 PM MDT... At 207 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southwest of Rockland, or 20 miles east of Malta. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 35 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sublett Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...35 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
